intro: Stellera annua, commonly known as the annual starwort, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Stellera annua is an herbaceous annual that completes its life cycle within one growing season.
